DataElement.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale (MSAS) 7-12 Yesterday or Today How Long Feel Sad Score 3 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of how long they felt sad yesterday or today, using a three-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale (MSAS) 7-12 Yesterday or Today How Long Feel Sad Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient-rated questionnaire designed to evaluate the prevalence, characteristics, and distress to young children with cancer aged 7-12. This 8-question instrument was adapted from a previously-validated adult version._The time period consisting of the current day and the preceding day._A question about how long an individual felt sad._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A patient-rated questionnaire designed to evaluate the prevalence, characteristics, and distress to young children with cancer aged 7-12. This 8-question instrument was adapted from a previously-validated adult version.

Concepts.definition: A patient-rated questionnaire designed to evaluate the prevalence, characteristics, and distress to young children with cancer aged 7-12. This 8-question instrument was adapted from a previously-validated adult version.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale (Pediatrics 7-10)  How Long 3 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 1 (A very short time) to 3 (Almost all the time) on a Likert scale used on the Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale (Pediatrics 7-12) questionnaire.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something happens or happened almost all of the time.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something happens or happened almost all of the time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something happens or happened for a medium amount of time.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something happens or happened for a medium amount of time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something happens or happened for a very short time.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something happens or happened for a very short time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: How long did you feel sad?
ReferenceDocuments.description: How long did you feel sad?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

DataElement.origin: MSAS 7-10: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale (7-10). J. Collins, et al. Journal of Pain and Symptom Management. 2002 Jan; 23(1): 10-16
